user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_DirClose_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_DirClose_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_dir_table, *token);

    closedir(impl->dp);
    impl->dp = NULL;

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_DirClose_Impl:
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t OS_impl_dir_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_DIRS]
...
typedef struct
{
    DIR *dp;
} OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The macro OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) expands &(tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))]). In the call OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_dir_table, *token) this becomes &OS_impl_dir_table[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(*token))] which is equivalent to using the original pointer 'token' without modifying it. OS_ObjectIndexFromToken takes a const OS_object_token_t * so no modification of the parameter or the pointer occurs. Therefore MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is not violated.
